item.title: Report E-2025070062
item.description:
Report E-2025070062

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-27
  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 27, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was punctured and released approximately 15-gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbent to the concrete floor and worked them in with hand tools, utilizing a cleaning agent with absorbent wipes to collect any residual product. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum. The damaged drum of product was overpacked.

item.title: Report E-2025070057
item.description:
Report E-2025070057

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-26
  • City: PIEDMONT
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 26, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1212 was punctured and released approximately 55-gallons of product to the trailer interior and concrete beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Carolina Environmental Response Team (CERT) to remediate the site. CERT personnel utilized hand tools, absorbents, and a vacuum unit to remediate the UN1212-impacted site. The damaged drum was placed into one (1) 95-gallon overpack and the impacted material and absorbents were collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums.

item.description:
Report X-2025061677

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-12
  • City: WEST COLUMBIA
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: GROUND LEAKING PACKAGE DISCOVERED. RESPONDED TO PACKAGE USING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS. CONTAINERIZED PACKAGE AND CLEAN UP MATERIALS IN A SPILL TRAY AND RETURNED TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. CONTENTS ARE XYLENES AT 100% REAGENT ALCOHOL. ONE BOTTLE WITH LOOSE CAP LEAKED IN AND OUT OF THE CARTON.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: SWA Flight 1844 BWI-TPA diverted to MRY due to a power bank in the passengers seat back pocket admitting black smoke due to thermal runaway. Halon and water used and o/b fire containment bag. Pictures available upon request.

item.title: Report I-2025060187
item.description:
Report I-2025060187

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-20
  • City: ROCK HILL
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Hilco liquid transport llc
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 14150
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hilco driver checked tank for water prior to loading, but failed to detect a small amount of water (improper preparation for transport). Driver loaded the hot asphalt product and left the facility. Roughly 20 minutes into his trip he noticed steam coming from the top of the trailer and immediately pulled over. As the steam came out of the vent pipe it siphoned product with the steam creating a boil over. Product did boil over for a few minutes and created a small spill of less than 25 gallons.

item.title: Report E-2025040566
item.description:
Report E-2025040566

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: SPARTANBURG
  • State: SC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX FREIGHT, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Upon opening the trailer to make a delivery at Costco in Spartanburg, SC the driver discovered a release. The driver pulled the trailer away from the dock door and authorities contacted. FedEx Freight sent a vendor out to remediate the release. The release was determined to be from a 55-gallon drum of Ultrasil 76. A nail protruding from the pallet rubbed a hole in the bottom of the drum during transit.
